required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 4-Day Study to Evaluate Phototoxicity of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A 4 Day, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment to Induce a Phototoxicity Skin Reaction in Healthy Subjects, Using a Controlled Photopatch Test

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 1 study is designed to determine the photoirritation potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) when application is followed by light exposure.

primary_outcome.description: To determine the photoirritation potential of CCP-020 when application is followed by light exposure by evaluating erythema response scores (0-3).
To determine the photoirritation potential of CCP-020 when application is followed by light exposure by evaluating edema response scores (0-2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days + 30 days after last product administration
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

arm_group.description: Cohort 1 will receive CCP-020 (diacerein 1% ointment) and vehicle as described below.

intervention.description: A total of 4 application sites (2 cm x 2 cm each) will be marked on the subject's lower thoracic area of the back: 2 sites on each side of the back - 2 sites for CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment.
A total of 4 application sites (2 cm x 2 cm each) will be marked on the subject's lower thoracic area of the back: 2 sites on each side of the back - 2 sites for CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Vehicle.
